name: Flute - CSW
description: Cinematic Studio Woodwinds Flute. Bright, airy tone with crystalline clarity. Perfect for lyrical solos and delicate passages.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously. Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Bright, airy, ethereal. The soprano voice of woodwinds. Pure and crystalline.
best_for: Doubling violin melody at unison or octave

register_character.low: C4-G4: Breathy, soft, intimate. Limited projection.
register_character.mid: G4-D6: Bright, clear, most expressive. Primary melodic range.
register_character.high: D6-C7: Brilliant, piercing. Use for special effects and climaxes.

ensemble_tips: Doubles violin melody beautifully at octave or unison
Creates shimmer when combined with strings tremolo
Pairs well with harp for ethereal textures
Can cut through orchestra in high register
Leave space for breath - natural phrases
avoid: Sustained low notes in loud passages (won't project)
Competing with brass in full orchestration
Very long phrases without breath marks

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate flute parts for Cinematic Studio Woodwinds. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any polyphonic passages (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range C4-C7, preferred D4-D7.
